data.text: In order to ease the lives of authors, editors, and trees, we present a
manual and an example of the use of Microsoft Word
for EasyChair-based electronic and on-paper publishing
The styles and parameters of this
are designed for compliance with the requirements for publication in
conference management system that is flexible, easy to use, and has many features to make it suitable for various conference models. It is currently probably the most commonly used c
, serving thousands of conferences every year.
EasyChair accepts documents written in any of the following formats:
), which can be produced by Microsoft Word.
This guide explains how to produce the
format in Microsoft Word. To achieve high quality of volumes, both
and Word documents should have the same layout and similar styles. This guide is provided for the users of Microsoft Word and describes EasyChair style version 3.4.
If you already prepared your paper using a different style, you can find it very hard to conform to the EasyChair style
The empty space on top of the first page, just before the title, will be reserved for a page header containing
logos and the volume information. This header will be added to the article when you submit it to EasyChair.

You cannot control this header placement and for this reason should not try to change vertical spacing on the first page. If by mistake you removed the empty space, you can restore it as follows. Place the cursor on the very first line of your document (that is, the first line of the title), select Format -> Paragraph in the Microsoft Word menu and set the spaci
ng before the paragraph to 94pt and after to 15pt.

style you can simply take this guide and modify it. Several Word document styles are defined and used in this guide. To apply these styles in Microsoft Word you can use the Formatting Palette. The first line should contain the title of the document and be in the style
. This line should be followed by a line in the style

which specifies authors of the publication, separated by commas, except for the last author which is separated from the rest of the authors by an “and”. Next to each author there may be a super-script number linking the author to an organization (see above) and a footnote specifying the role of the author in preparation of the publication.
The author line should be followed by lines in the style
which provide the organizations with which the authors are affiliated. After each institute there are contact details of the authors in the style
The abstract should begin with a line in the style
containing the word “Abstract”, and the abstract itself should use the style
Section headers should use the style
, while subsection headers use the style
. For example, this text is part of Section 2 (Styles) and Subsection 2.1 (Styles for the Article Body).
The main text of the document should be written using the style
. For mono-spaced parts of the text (such as source code listings) we provide the style
. For a sans serif font, use the style
. In this guide, we use the sans serif style for the names of Word styles.
While section headers should use the style
, the header of the References section should be in the style
. This style is similar to the style
, but it is not numbered, again to resemble the EasyChair
citations it is recommended that you use the bibliography mechanisms of Microsoft Word or other tools able to process
documents. In Microsoft Word, commands for inserting citations are located at the
tab of the ribbon control in the section

button opens a toolbox, which allows you to add referenced publications and to insert them at the position of the cursor by double-clicking on them. If you use Microsoft Word for Mac, open the main toolbox and select the
tab instead. From there you can add and insert referenced publications as in other versions of Word.
bibliography) section of the article is created by clicking on the
tab of the ribbon control in Microsoft Word for Mac).
After inserting this section, the style of
automatically generated References section may need to be explicitly updated to reflect further changes done in the bibliography. When clicking on the automatically generated text of the section, a
button will appear in the text and offer a menu with an update command
tyle used for citations in this template is APA.
You are free to use any other style.
This is an example of the use of citations and references
Not much is written yet about EasyChair. Apart from the Wikipedia article that comes and goes
and contains a sketchy and questionable material
, there is an abstract of a keynote talk on EasyChair presented at the 2014 Automated Software Engineering Conference
and a guide for writing documents for EasyChair authors
The references themselves are placed at the end of this document.
can be inserted into the document by going to Insert->Picture->From File…
. To simplify working with the image, it is recommended that you insert the picture into a text box.
make it into a figure and
add a caption, select the image by clicking on it and then go to Insert->Caption…
in earlier versions of Microsoft Word).
From here, you can select the position of the caption (
below the image) and edit the text within it.
Make sure that “Figure” is selected in the “Label”
to generate it. Captions are numbered automatically in
s an example of a captioned image.
If you have a table in your document, captions can be created in the same way, just select “Table” from the “Label” drop-down list instead.
shows an example of a table of data that was conveniently available.
In order to cross-reference a figure or table in your text, go to Insert->Cross-reference… (

Insert->Reference->Cross-reference… in earlier versions) from the Word menu. Select the type of object you are referencing in the “Reference type” drop-down list, and then select which object you are referencing under “For which caption”. Ensure that the “Insert as hyperlink” box is ticked. You can choose how much of the caption is inserted in the “Insert reference to” drop-menu.
For example, to generate this cross-reference for
are set to conform to the requirements of
f the settings are altered, the requirements below need to be
papers deviating from the formatting stan
This section is mostly for your information since the best way to produce a conforming document is by modifying this guide.
default paper size is US letter, but A4
all of the acceptable paper sizes
is 145x224 mm. This size has been selected to allow for inexpensive printing using our current print-on-demand publisher.
, and the sans-serif font is Helvetica. The base font size is 10pt. If you use any other font size, there is no guarantee that the produced document will look nice or f
it into our standard page size.
PNG, JPG, and PDF images are supported. If the papers are designed for publishing in print, the images should be at least 300dpi in resolution.
You will see if your article deviates from the EasyChair style page margins when you
bugs, errors, and omissions you find
What to do if You Already C
If you have produced your paper using different styles than the ones defined here, your document can still be accepted by EasyChair provided it has got the correct paper size
can be set from the tab
choose Microsoft Word from the topmost box
set up the margins as follows:
On the current screen, the top, bottom, left and right margins are given in
, your version of Word may well give the measurements in the metric system
In this case you should set up the margins in centimeters as follows
be put on the very top of the first page and have spacing of 94
If the above instructions are followed, this is how the first page of a paper will look with the EasyChair
The Kalpa Publications header will be different but use the same space.
In case there is not enough space for the header, the title of the paper will be only partially
You can check whether you set page margins and title spacing correctly when you upload your paper to EasyChair (read the next section).
This section is intended only for the authors and editors of EasyChair proceedings
. When you prepare an article for
, it should be submitted through EasyChair. EasyChair automates the submission process as much as possible and goes to a great
to ensure that your article can be published and printed. Publication for EasyChair
means much more than just putting a PDF of your article o
information about the article to classify it, find similar articles, make it easily searchable, and index it in vari
Please note that, when your conference is hosted on EasyChair, your article can be submitted twice: first for
reviewing and then for inclusion in the proceedings. You will see that EasyChair has different environments and different interface
You can tell which one you are in by your role displayed in the upper left corner of the screen. For the submission phase, it should display “author” and for the proceedings stage
“proceedings author”. These two environments will look like this:
If you are asked to submit your final version a
nd you only see the author role
, then something is very wrong and you should contact your conference organizers or volume editors.

It is up to your conference in what format you submit your article. Most likely, they will simply ask for a PDF file. You will see the list of accepted file types on the EasyChair submission page. Nonetheless, if your conference will publish proceedings
use the EasyChair style for the sub
mission too. The reason is that otherwise, if your paper is accepted for the proceedings, you will have to reformat it using the EasyChair style
If you need to submit a PDF document, you can convert your
document to PDF by choosing File->Save As… in your Word menu.
Submitting the Final Version for the Proceedings
will ask you to submit two documents: the original
The PDF document must be obtained by saving your Word
EasyChair will show your PDF document with a frame around it to ensure that you did not change the style so that the content of your document

out of the style margins. It will also ask you to enter some meta-data about your article, such as the title, list of authors, and the abstract.  This meta-data is very important since it will appear on the Web page where your article is published, therefore EasyChair will ask you to check that it is consistent with the data in the article itself.
